The Scappoose School District would like to announce that Dr. Jennifer Stackhouse has been selected to be the principal of Otto Petersen Elementary beginning July 1, 2018.

Dr. Stackhouse comes to us most recently from the Gresham-Barlow School District where she spent four years as the Response to Intervention Coordinator. In this role she served eleven elementary schools and four middle schools, implementing response to intervention across the Gresham-Barlow School District. Before her role as the Response to Intervention Coordinator, Dr. Stackhouse taught for ten years with the Beaverton School District in grades 1 - 3. She also student taught in the David Douglas School District in 3rd and 5th grades.

Dr. Stackhouse’s doctoral dissertation was on professional learning communities and administrative supports for collaboration. Dr. Stackhouse has excellent skills in coaching teachers in instructional strategies, leading teams in the important work that we do in education and working with students and families who have experienced trauma.

Welcome Dr. Jennifer Stackhouse!

Oregon graduation rate increases nearly 2 percentage points

Oregon School Boards Association
January 25, 2018 at 9:33 AM ·

Oregon’s graduation rate, among the lowest in the nation, has been ticking up recently, and this is the largest year-over-year improvement since ODE changed the way it calculated graduation rates for the 2013-14 school year.

Acting Deputy Superintendent of Public Instruction Colt Gill said Wednesday the graduation rate improvement shows a concerted statewide effort, and he praised OSBA’s leadership with graduation-rate focused projects and programs.

“It says to me that school districts – from board members to teachers to school bus drivers to everybody – are focused on the graduation issue,” he said. “They’re using data to aim their resources in ways that make a difference for students.”

The Scappoose School District has accepted Superintendent Jupe’s resignation, effective June 30, 2017. Our board wishes to thank Mr. Jupe for his service to our district and wishes him well in his future endeavors.

We are delighted to announce the appointment of our next Facilities Manager, Bruce Rask.

Bruce has worked for Scappoose School District in our maintenance department for five years. He is well known in our school community and has worked on all of our buildings, their systems and equipment. Bruce understands what schools need and how they function.

For years he was a department supervisor with 23 staff under him at Capstone Paper, formerly Longview Fibre Co. Prior to working with the school district Bruce returned to school and earned a degree in Industrial Maintenance.

Bruce will take over from Tom Weaver on July 1st when Tom retires after 30 years of service.

Please take time to congratulate him when you see him.
